<title level="1" right="Rules">[Observed](/Rules.aspx?ID=2415)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 434 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
In most circumstances, you can sense creatures without difficulty and target them normally. Creatures in this state are [observed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=84). Observing requires a [precise sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=2406), which for most creatures means sight. If you can’t observe the creature, it’s either [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79), [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96), or [unnoticed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=98), and you’ll need to factor in the targeting restrictions. Even if a creature is observed, it might still be [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62).
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
